item.title: Espressif ESP32: Bypassing Flash Encryption (CVE-2020-15048)
item.description: In our previous post we described an attack where we load an arbitrary value indirectly into the PC register using EMFI.

item.title: Espressif ESP32: Controlling PC during Secure Boot
item.description: In our previous post we demonstrated that the ESP32 chip is vulnerable to EMFI.

item.title: Fault Injection Reference Model (FIRM)
item.description: In today's world, physical access to a device is considered a significant threat as devices often play a central role for the underlying business model.

item.title: Espressif ESP32: Bypassing Secure Boot using EMFI
item.description: Our research during the last few years definitely points out our interest in Fault Injection (FI) attacks.

item.title: Security Advisories: D-Link DSL-2640B
item.description: In a previous post we shared our considerations on the impact of vulnerabilities in Internet connected devices that are EoL.

item.title: Threat After Death: Security Impact of EoL Devices
item.description: We identified several vulnerabilities in the D-Link DSL-2640B DSL gateway which will likely not be fixed as the device is EoL (more details will come soon).
